DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Immune Radiolabeled Antibody Therapy Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator for a dose of agent containing a radioactive isotope being administered to a patient. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Immune Radioactive Antibody Therapy Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the nonprotocol immune radiolabeled antibody therapy being administered._A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents._Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms._Treatment with an antibody, a substance that can directly kill specific tumor cells or stimulate the immune system to kill tumor cells._Giving off radiation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Trial Protocol Immune Radioactive Antibody Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Giving off radiation. :Treatment with an antibody, a substance that can directly kill specific tumor cells or stimulate the immune system to kill tumor cells.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms.
Treatment with injections of antibodies to directly destroy specific, usually cancerous, cells or to stimulate the immune system to destroy those cells.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CCR Surgery (Immunotherapy) legacy data migration
